description: Socrates founded political philosophy by asking the question "What is justice?"  Ancient
political philosophers followed his lead offering different answers. Students study the
most famous works of classical political philosophy and their relation to larger themes
in contemporary politics. The main texts assigned are Plato's Republic,
Aristotle's Politics and selections from St. Augustine's City of God and
St.Thomas Aquinas' Summa. Counts toward ancient studies major.
